alfredsnippet.snippet:
"In 1846 Michael Faraday wrote in his diary: 'All I can say is, that I do not perceive in any part of space, whether (to use the common phrase) vacant or filled with matter, anything but forces and the lines in which they exerted.' This was the beginning of the dominant modern physics theories, where it is the geometric and physical conditions of space itself that is fundamental."

- Bryan Wallace, The Farce of Physics
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Michael Faraday's Observation of Space
